inclusion.criterion: fill out the STAI questionnaire to assess the level of anxiety prior to placement of the labor epidural catheter, and before knowing their group assignment.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: fill out the Pain Catastrophizing Scale form with 13 statements, and asked to fill it out as directed in the instructions at the top.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: ask who their primary support person is
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: randomized as to whether her companion will be allowed in the room or will be asked to leave.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: placement of the labor epidural catheter
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: fill out the STAI questionnaire again after completion of the neuraxial procedure.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: record her perception of pain during the placement of the labor epidural catheter, using a VAS (Visual Analogue Scale) from 0-100mm.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: receiving neuraxial anesthesia for a cesarean delivery
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: begin to push for delivery before completion of the STAI questionnaire following labor epidural catheter placement.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: no support person present at the time of the neuraxial procedure
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: A 54-year-old woman with abnormal cervical squamous intraepithelial/glandular lesion, HPV 16 positive, menopausal and uses no contraception. She smokes and drinks alcohol frequently.
